intro: Ichnocarpus parkinsonii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, woody pods that contain a milky sap, which is a key feature of its botanical description. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannas and rocky areas. The sap has been traditionally used for various purposes, including as a remedy and in the production of rubber.
